props.code: typedef void(* projectm_playlist_preset_switched_event) (bool is_hard_cut, unsigned int index, void *user_data);

children.value: Callback function that is executed on each preset change.
True if the preset was switched using a hard cut via beat detection.
The playlist index of the new preset.
A user-defined data pointer that was provided when registering the callback, e.g. context information.
Can be used for example to UpdateMeshSize the application window title. Applications must not switch presets inside this callback, as it can lead to infinite recursion.

props.code: typedef void(* projectm_playlist_preset_switch_failed_event) (const char *preset_filename, const char *message, void *user_data);

children.value: Callback function that is executed if a preset change failed too often.
The filename of the failed preset.
A user-defined data pointer that was provided when registering the callback, e.g. context information.
Do NOT call any functions that switch presets inside the callback, at it might lead to infinite recursion and thus a stack overflow!
The message pointer is only valid inside the callback. Make a copy if it need to be retained for later use.

Similar to the projectM API function, but will only be called if the preset switch failed multiple times in a row, e.g. due to missing files or broken presets. The application should decide what action to take.

    projectm_playlist_preset_switched_event callback,
    void * user_data
)

children.value: Sets a callback function that will be called when a preset changes.
A pointer to the callback function.
A pointer to any data that will be sent back in the callback, e.g. context information.
Only one callback can be registered per playlist instance. To remove the callback, use NULL.

A pointer to any data that will be sent back in the callback, e.g. context information.
Only one callback can be registered per projectM instance. To remove the callback, use NULL.

, respectively, as these will both override the callback set in projectM.

Creates a playlist manager for the given projectM instance.
The projectM instance to connect to. Can be a null pointer to leave the newly created playlist instance unconnected.
: An opaque pointer to the newly created playlist manager instance. Null if creation failed.

Only one active playlist manager is supported per projectM instance. If multiple playlists use the same projectM instance, only the last created playlist manager will receive preset change callbacks from the projectM instance.

Destroys a previously created playlist manager.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT void projectm_playlist_connect(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    projectm_handle projectm_instance

children.value: Connects the playlist manager to a projectM instance.
The projectM instance to connect to. Can be a null pointer to remove an existing binding and clear the projectM preset switch callback.
Sets or removes the preset switch callbacks and stores the projectM instance handle for use with manual preset switches via the playlist API.

When switching between multiple playlist managers, first call this method on the last used playlist manager with a null pointer for the projectM instance, then call this method with the actual projectM instance on the playlist manager that should be activated. It is also safe to call
with a null projectM handle on all playlist manager instances before activating a single one with a valid, non-null projectM handle.
instance, const char ** filter_list, size_t count)
Applies the current filter list to the existing playlist.
projectM – Milkdrop-esque visualisation SDK Copyright (C)2003-2023 projectM Team

This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA See 'LICENSE.txt' included within this release
The size of the filter array.
Does not immediately apply the new list to an existing playlist, only newly added files will be affected. If you need to filter the existing playlist after calling this method, additionally call
The filter list consists of simple globbing expressions similar to the .gitignore syntax:
: When used at the begin of a glob, matches if pathname has no path separator.
**/****: When at the end of the glob, matches everything after the /.

In globbing expressions, \ can be used as path separator instead of /. The backslash can't be used to escape globbing patterns, so matching literal * and ? in filenames is not possible. This is not a huge issue as Windows doesn't allow those characters in filenames and Milkdrop files originate from the Windows world. Character classes like "
" are also not supported to keep the syntax simple.

Each line can be prefixed with either + or - to either include files matching the pattern or excluding them. Any other character is not interpreted as a prefix and the filter line is matching as an exclude filter. To match a literal + or - at the beginning, add the appropriate prefix in front. Empty filters never match anything, even if the filename is empty.

The filter list is checked in order. The first pattern that matches the filename determines the filter result (include or exclude). If no pattern matches, the file is included. In the case that a default exclude action is required, add a "-/‍**" filter at the end of the list.

props.code:

on the returned pointer if the data is no longer needed.

Note this function only removes items. Previously filtered items are not added again. If items were removed, the playback history is cleared.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT char ** projectm_playlist_items(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t start,
    uint32_t count
)

children.value: Returns a list of preset files inside the given range of the current playlist, in order.
The zero-based starting index of the range to return.
The maximum number if items to return.
: A pointer to a list of char pointers, each containing a single preset. The last entry is denoted by a null pointer.
when you're done using the list.
Ideally, don't rely on the value provided as count to iterate over the filenames. Instead, look for the terminating null pointer to abort the loop.
This function can be used to return the whole playlist to save it to a file, or just a part of it for use in virtual lists. If less elements than given in
are available, only the remainder of items after the starting index are returned. If the starting index equals or exceeds the playlist size, an empty list is returned.

when you're done using the return value.
If you need to retrieve a major part of playlist filenames, use
Appends presets from the given path to the end of the current playlist.
A local filesystem path to scan for presets.
If true, subdirectories of the given path will also be scanned. If false, only the exact path given is searched for presets.
If true, files found will always be added. If false, only files are added that do not already exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added. 0 may indicate issues scanning the path.
This method will scan the given path for files with a ".milk" extension and add these to the playlist.

children.value: Inserts presets from the given path to the end of the current playlist.
A local filesystem path to scan for presets.
The index to insert the presets at. If it exceeds the playlist size, the presets are added at the end of the playlist.
If true, subdirectories of the given path will also be scanned. If false, only the exact path given is searched for presets.
If true, files found will always be added. If false, only files are added that do not already exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added. 0 may indicate issues scanning the path.
This method will scan the given path for files with a ".milk" extension and add these to the playlist.
Adds a single preset to the end of the playlist.
If true, the preset filename will always be added. If false, the preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: True if the file was added to the playlist, false if the file was a duplicate and allow_duplicates was set to false.
: The file is not checked for existence or for being readable.
Adds a single preset to the playlist at the specified position.
The index to insert the preset at. If it exceeds the playlist size, the preset is added at the end of the playlist.
If true, the preset filename will always be added. If false, the preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: True if the file was added to the playlist, false if the file was a duplicate and allow_duplicates was set to false.
: The file is not checked for existence or for being readable.
To always add a file at the end of the playlist, use

A list of local preset filenames.
The number of files in the list.
If true, the preset filenames will always be added. If false, a preset is only added to the playlist if the exact filename doesn't exist in the current playlist.
: The number of files added to the playlist. Ranges between 0 and count.
: The files are not checked for existence or for being readable.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT void projectm_playlist_sort(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t start_index,
    uint32_t count,
    projectm_playlist_sort_predicate predicate,
    projectm_playlist_sort_order order
)

children.value: Sorts part or the whole playlist according to the given predicate and order.
The starting index to begin sorting at.
The number of items, beginning at start_index, to sort.
The predicate to use for sorting. Default is SORT_PREDICATE_FULL_PATH.
The sort order. Default is SORT_ORDER_ASCENDING.

It is safe to provide values in start_index and count that will exceed the number of items in the playlist. Only items that fall into an existing index range are sorted. If start_index is equal to or larger than the playlist size, no items are sorted. If start_index is inside the playlist, but adding count results in an index outside the playlist, items until the end are sorted.
Sort order is lexicographical for both predicates and case-sensitive.
If invalid values are provides as predicate or order, the defaults as mentioned in the parameter description are used.
Frees a char pointer returned by any of the playlist API functions.
Frees a string array returned by any of the playlist API functions.

PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT void projectm_playlist_set_shuffle(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    bool shuffle
)

children.value: True to enable random shuffling, false to play presets in playlist order.
Retrieves the current state of shuffle mode.
: True if shuffle mode is enabled, false otherwise.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT void projectm_playlist_set_retry_count(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t retry_count
)

children.value: Sets the number of retries after failed preset switches.
The number of retries after failed preset switches. Default is 5. Set to 0 to simply forward the failure event from projectM.
: Don't set this value too high, as each retry is done recursively.
Returns the number of retries after failed preset switches.
: The number of retries after failed preset switches.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT uint32_t projectm_playlist_set_position(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    uint32_t new_position,
    bool hard_cut
)

children.value: Plays the preset at the requested playlist position and returns the actual playlist index.
The new position to jump to.
If true, the preset transition is instant. If true, a smooth transition is played.
: The new playlist position. If the playlist is empty, 0 will be returned.
If the requested position is out of bounds, the returned position will wrap to 0, effectively repeating the playlist as if shuffle was disabled. It has no effect if the playlist is empty.
This method ignores the shuffle setting and will always jump to the requested index, given it is withing playlist bounds.
: The current playlist position. If the playlist is empty, 0 will be returned.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT uint32_t projectm_playlist_play_next(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    bool hard_cut
)

children.value: Plays the next playlist item and returns the index of the new preset.
If true, the preset transition is instant. If true, a smooth transition is played.
: The new playlist position. If the playlist is empty, 0 will be returned.
If shuffle is on, it will select a random preset, otherwise the next in the playlist. If the end of the playlist is reached in continuous mode, it will wrap back to 0.
The old playlist item is added to the history.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT uint32_t projectm_playlist_play_previous(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    bool hard_cut
)

children.value: Plays the previous playlist item and returns the index of the new preset.
If true, the preset transition is instant. If true, a smooth transition is played.
: The new playlist position. If the playlist is empty, 0 will be returned.
If shuffle is on, it will select a random preset, otherwise the next in the playlist. If the end of the playlist is reached in continuous mode, it will wrap back to 0.
The old playlist item is added to the history.

props.code:
PROJECTM_PLAYLIST_EXPORT uint32_t projectm_playlist_play_last(
    projectm_playlist_handle instance,
    bool hard_cut
)

children.value: Plays the last preset played in the history and returns the index of the preset.
If true, the preset transition is instant. If true, a smooth transition is played.
: The new playlist position. If the playlist is empty, 0 will be returned.
The history keeps track of the last 1000 presets and will go back in the history. The playback history will be cleared whenever the playlist items are changed.
If the history is empty, this call behaves identical to
, but the item is not added to the history.
Presets which failed to load are not recorded in the history and thus will be skipped when calling this method.

props.code: typedef struct projectm_playlist* projectm_playlist_handle;

children.value: A pointer to the opaque projectM playlist instance.

Host-defined lock function. Used to prevent race conditions with memory access. Only required if multiple expressions using the same global/local memory blocks will run in separate threads at the same time. Can be an empty function otherwise. The function is not required to use a recursive mutex.

Host-defined unlock function. Used to prevent race conditions with memory access. Only required if multiple expressions using the same global/local memory blocks will run in separate threads at the same time. Can be an empty function otherwise.
Allocates an empty memory buffer to hold gmegabuf data.
Destroys a memory buffer and frees any allocated blocks. Only destroy a buffer if no context is using it anymore.
Frees the built-in global memory buffer. Only destroy the global buffer if no context is using it anymore.

Destroys an execution context and frees all associated resources. Any code and variable references associated with the destroyed context will become invalid and must not be used after calling this function.
Frees the allocated memory of the context-local buffer, effectively resetting it. This will not clear the global memory buffer associated with the context.
Sets all context variables to 0.0. Registered variables will be kept intact, as the pointers will not change. Global variables reg00 to reg99 will also stay unchanged.

Registers a variable and returns the value pointer. Variables can be registered at any time. If the variable doesn't exist yet, it is created, otherwise the existing variable is being returned. Any code compiled before or after will use the same variable, referenced by its case-insensitive name.
Compiled the given code into an executable program. Call
to retrieve the compiler error and location on compilation failure.

Destroys a previously compiled code handle. Frees only the compiled code, but no associated resources like variables and megabuf contents. This makes it possible to recompile code and execute it in the same context without changing the state. Do not use the code handle after destroying it.
Executes the code in the given handle.
(struct projectm_eval_context * ctx, int * line, int * column)
Returns the error message of the last failed compile operation in the given context. The error message is cleared every time new code is compiled.

Frees the allocated memory of the context-local buffer, effectively resetting it. This will not clear the global memory buffer associated with the context.
The context which memory should be freed.
Sets all context variables to 0.0. Registered variables will be kept intact, as the pointers will not change. Global variables reg00 to reg99 will also stay unchanged.
The context in which to reset the variables.

props.code:
PRJM_EVAL_F * projectm_eval_context_register_variable(
    struct projectm_eval_context * ctx,
    const char * var_name
)

children.value: Registers a variable and returns the value pointer. Variables can be registered at any time. If the variable doesn't exist yet, it is created, otherwise the existing variable is being returned. Any code compiled before or after will use the same variable, referenced by its case-insensitive name.
The context in which to register the variables.
The name of the variable. Case-insensitive.
: A pointer to the actual value of the variable.

props.code:
struct projectm_eval_code * projectm_eval_code_compile(
    struct projectm_eval_context * ctx,
    const char * code
)

children.value: Compiled the given code into an executable program. Call
to retrieve the compiler error and location on compilation failure.
The context to associate the code with.
: A handle for the compiled program or NULL if compilation failed.

Destroys a previously compiled code handle. Frees only the compiled code, but no associated resources like variables and megabuf contents. This makes it possible to recompile code and execute it in the same context without changing the state. Do not use the code handle after destroying it.
Executes the code in the given handle.
: The return value of the last expression on the top-level instruction list of the program.
Returns the error message of the last failed compile operation in the given context. The error message is cleared every time new code is compiled.
The context to retrieve the error from.
A pointer to an integer which will receive the line number in which the error was found. Pass NULL if the value is of no interest.
A pointer to an integer which will receive the column number in which the error was found. Pass NULL if the value is of no interest.
: A pointer to an error message. The context keeps ownership of the pointer, do not free it.

props.code: #define PRJM_F_SIZE 8

children.value: /* Default floating-point number size in bytes (4 = float, 8 = double) */
/* On 32-bit platforms, it may be more performant to use floats. */

props.code: PROJECTM_EXPORT unsigned int projectm_pcm_get_max_samples()

children.value: Returns the maximum number of audio samples that can be stored.
: The number of audio samples that are stored, per channel.
Each PCM data UpdateMeshSize should not exceed this number of samples. If more samples are added, only this number of samples is stored and the remainder discarded.
An array of PCM samples. Each sample is expected to be within the range -1 to 1.
The number of audio samples in a channel.
If the buffer is mono or stereo. Can be PROJECTM_MONO or PROJECTM_STEREO.
This function is used to add new audio data to projectM's internal audio buffer. It is internally converted to 2-channel float data, duplicating the channel.
If stereo, the channel order in samples is LRLRLR.
The number of audio samples in a channel.
If the buffer is mono or stereo. Can be PROJECTM_MONO or PROJECTM_STEREO.
This function is used to add new audio data to projectM's internal audio buffer. It is internally converted to 2-channel float data, duplicating the channel.
If stereo, the channel order in samples is LRLRLR.
The number of audio samples in a channel.
If the buffer is mono or stereo. Can be PROJECTM_MONO or PROJECTM_STEREO.
This function is used to add new audio data to projectM's internal audio buffer. It is internally converted to 2-channel float data, duplicating the channel.
If stereo, the channel order in samples is LRLRLR.

props.code: PROJECTM_EXPORT projectm_handle projectm_create()

children.value: : A projectM handle for the newly created instance that must be used in subsequent API calls. NULL if the instance could not be created successfully.
If this function returns NULL, in most cases the OpenGL context is not initialized, not made current or insufficient to render projectM visuals.
Destroys the given instance and frees the resources.
After destroying the handle, it must not be used for any other calls to the API.
Loads a preset from the given filename/URL.
The preset filename or URL to load.
If true, the new preset is smoothly blended over.

Ideally, the filename should be given as a standard local path. projectM also supports loading "file://" URLs. Additionally, the special filename "idle://" can be used to load the default idle preset, displaying the "M" logo.
Other URL schemas aren't supported and will cause a loading error.

If the preset can't be loaded, no switch takes place and the current preset will continue to be displayed. Note that if there's a transition in progress when calling this function, the transition will be finished immediately, even if the new preset can't be loaded.
Loads a preset from the data pointer.
If true, the new preset is smoothly blended over.
Currently, the preset data is assumed to be in Milkdrop format.

If the preset can't be loaded, no switch takes place and the current preset will continue to be displayed. Note that if there's a transition in progress when calling this function, the transition will be finished immediately, even if the new preset can't be loaded.
Calling this method will clear and reload all textures, including the main rendering texture. Can cause a small delay/lag in rendering. Only use if texture paths were changed.

)

children.value: Returns the runtime library version components as individual integers.
A pointer to an int that will be set to the major version.
A pointer to an int that will be set to the minor version.
A pointer to an int that will be set to the patch version.
Components which aren't required can be set to NULL.

on the returned pointer if the data is no longer needed.

on the returned pointer if the data is no longer needed.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_write_debug_image_on_next_frame(
    projectm_handle instance,
    const char * output_file
)

children.value: Writes a .bmp main texture dump after rendering the next main texture, before shaders are applied.
The filename to write the dump to or NULL.
If no file name is given, the image is written to the current working directory and will be named named "frame_texture_contents-YYYY-mm-dd-HH:MM:SS-frame.bmp".

Note this is the main texture contents, not the final rendering result. If the active preset uses a composite shader, the dumped image will not have it applied. The main texture is what is passed over to the next frame, the composite shader is only applied to the display framebuffer after updating the main texture.
To capture the actual output, dump the contents of the main framebuffer after calling

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_beat_sensitivity(
    projectm_handle instance,
    float sensitivity
)

children.value: The beat sensitivity to be used.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_hard_cut_duration(
    projectm_handle instance,
    double seconds
)

children.value: Sets the minimum display time before a hard cut can happen.
Minimum number of seconds the preset will be displayed before a hard cut.
Hard cuts are beat-sensitive preset transitions, immediately changing from one preset to the next without a smooth blending period.
Set this to a higher value than preset duration to disable hard cuts.
Returns the minimum display time before a hard cut can happen.
: The minimum number of seconds the preset will be displayed before a hard cut.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_hard_cut_enabled(
    projectm_handle instance,
    bool enabled
)

children.value: True to enable hard cuts, false to disable.
Even if enabled, the hard cut duration must be set to a value lower than the preset duration to work properly.
Returns whether hard cuts are enabled or not.
: True if hard cuts are enabled, false otherwise.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_hard_cut_sensitivity(
    projectm_handle instance,
    float sensitivity
)

children.value: Sets the hard cut volume sensitivity.
The volume threshold that triggers a hard cut if surpassed.
The beat detection volume difference that must be surpassed to trigger a hard cut.
Returns the current hard cut sensitivity.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_soft_cut_duration(
    projectm_handle instance,
    double seconds
)

children.value: Sets the time in seconds for a soft transition between two presets.
Time in seconds it takes to smoothly transition from one preset to another.
During a soft cut, both presets are rendered and slowly transitioned from one to the other.
Returns the time in seconds for a soft transition between two presets.
: Time in seconds it takes to smoothly transition from one preset to another.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_preset_duration(
    projectm_handle instance,
    double seconds
)

children.value: Sets the preset display duration before switching to the next using a soft cut.
The number of seconds a preset will be displayed before the next is shown.
This can be considered as the maximum time a preset is displayed. If this time is reached, a smooth cut will be initiated. A hard cut, if any, will always happen before this time.
Returns the preset display duration before switching to the next using a soft cut.
: The currently set preset display duration in seconds.
This can be considered as the maximum time a preset is displayed. If this time is reached, a smooth cut will be initiated. A hard cut, if any, will always happen before this time.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_mesh_size(
    projectm_handle instance,
    size_t width,
    size_t height
)

children.value: Sets the per-pixel equation mesh size in units.
The new width of the mesh.
The new height of the mesh.
: This will currently remove any active presets and reload the default "idle" preset.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_get_mesh_size(
    projectm_handle instance,
    size_t * width,
    size_t * height
)

children.value: Returns the per-pixel equation mesh size in units.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_fps(
    projectm_handle instance,
    int32_t fps
)

children.value: Sets the current/average frames per second.
The current FPS value projectM is running with.

Applications running projectM should UpdateMeshSize this value regularly and set it to the calculated (and possibly averaged) FPS value the output rendered with. The value is passed on to presets, which may choose to use it for calculations. It is not used in any other way by the library.
Returns the current/average frames per second.
This value needs to be set by the application. If it wasn't set, a default value of 60 is used.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_aspect_correction(
    projectm_handle instance,
    bool enabled
)

children.value: Enabled or disables aspect ratio correction in presets that support it.
True to enable aspect correction, false to disable it.
This sets a flag presets can use to aspect-correct rendered shapes, which otherwise would be distorted if the viewport isn't exactly square.
Returns whether aspect ratio correction is enabled or not.
: True if aspect ratio correction is enabled, false otherwise.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_easter_egg(
    projectm_handle instance,
    float value
)

children.value: This doesn't enable any fancy feature, it only influences the randomized display time of presets. It's passed as the "sigma" value of the gaussian random number generator used to determine the maximum display time, effectively multiplying the generated number of seconds by this amount.
See function sampledPresetDuration() of the TimeKeeper class on how it is used.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_preset_locked(
    projectm_handle instance,
    bool lock
)

children.value: Locks or unlocks the current preset.
True to lock the current preset, false to enable automatic transitions.
Locking effectively disables automatic preset transitions, both hard and soft cuts. Programmatic preset switches will still be executed.
Returns whether the current preset is locked or not.
: True if the preset lock is enabled, false otherwise.

props.code:
PROJECTM_EXPORT void projectm_set_window_size(
    projectm_handle instance,
    size_t width,
    size_t height
)

children.value: Sets the current viewport size in pixels.
Calling this function will reset the OpenGL renderer.

The y coordinate of the touch event.
The amount of pressure applied in a range from 0.0 to 1.0.
The waveform type that will be rendered on touch.

This will add or move waveforms in addition to the preset waveforms. If there is an existing waveform at the given coordinates, it will be centered on the new coordinates. If there is no waveform, a new one will be added.

#define PROJECTM_VERSION_STRING "4.0.0"

#pragma once

#define PROJECTM_VERSION_MAJOR 4
#define PROJECTM_VERSION_MINOR 0
#define PROJECTM_VERSION_PATCH 0

/* Full version number as a string literal */

/* VCS version number, e.g. Git commit hash */

children.value: /* Full version number as a string literal */
/* VCS version number, e.g. Git commit hash */
